class.name: jsx3.app.Server
class.text: The controller of the JSX architecture.

constructor.name: init

param.name: strAppPath
param.text: URL (either relative or absolute) for the application to load

param.name: objGUI
param.text: the browser element (body, div, span, td, etc) into which the GI application should load

param.name: bPaint
param.text: false if null; if true, the application VIEW will immediately be generated.

constructor.text: Sets environment variables used by this class (the controller for the JSX architecture)

field.name: HELP
field.text:
The subject of an event that instances of this class publish when a context help hot key is pressed in the context of a DOM node that has a help ID. The event has the following fields:
target - the server publishing the event.
model - the DOM node that received the key event.
helpid - the help ID of the nearest ancestor of model that defines a help ID.

field.name: INITED
field.text: The subject of an event that jsx3.app.Server publishes when an instance of this class is created. The target of the event object is the initialized server.

method.name: createAppWindow

param.name: strName
param.text: the unique name of the window to create

throws.text: if there already exists a window in this server by that name

method.text: Creates a new jsx3.gui.Window instance for this server. A branch of the DOM of this application can be placed in this window in order to distribute the application across multiple browser windows.

method.name: deleteCookie

param.name: name
param.text: name of the cookie

param.name: path
param.text: path where the cookie is valid (default: path of calling document)

param.name: domain
param.text: domain where the cookie is valid (default: domain of calling document)

method.text: delete a cookie

method.name: destroy
method.text: call to shut down a server instance and free up resources used by the server (cache,dom,etc)

method.name: getAlertsParent
method.text: To implement jsx3.gui.Alerts interface.

method.name: getAppWindow

param.name: strName
param.text: the unique name of the window to retrieve

return.text: the window instance or null if no such window exists.

method.text: Retrieves a previously created jsx3.gui.Window instance.

method.name: getBodyBlock
method.text: Returns the body block for this server (JSXBODY)

method.name: getCache
method.text: Returns the XML/XSL cache for this server

method.name: getCookie

param.name: name
param.text: name of the cookie

method.text: Returns the value for the Cookie with the given @name

method.name: getDOM
method.text: Returns the DOM for this server

method.name: getDefaultLocale
method.text: Returns the default locale of this server. This is configured with the default_locale configuration setting.

method.name: getDocumentOf
method.text: Returns the browser document object containing a particular JSX object. This method inspects whether the JSX object is a descendent of the root block of this server or one of its jsx3.gui.Window roots.

method.name: getDynamicProperty

param.name: strPropName
param.text: id for this dynamic property among all properties

param.name: strToken
param.text: if present tokens such as {0}, {1}, {n} will be replaced with the nth element of this vararg array

method.text: Returns the value of the dynamic property @strPropName

method.name: getEnv

param.name: strEnvKey
param.text: the case-insensitive key of the environment variable to return.

method.text:
Returns the value of an environment variable of this server. Valid keys correspond to deployment options and include:
VERSION
APPPATH
ABSPATH
CAPTION
MODE
SYSTEM
NAMESPACE
CANCELERROR
CANCELRIGHTCLICK
BODYHOTKEYS
WIDTH
HEIGHT
LEFT
TOP
POSITION
OVERFLOW
UNICODE
EVENTSVERS
Other environment variables may be set either by query parameters in the launch page URL, by attributes on the GI script tag, or by entries in the server's config.xml file. Server environment variable keys must either begin with "jsxapp" or must not begin with "jsx".

method.name: getJSX

param.name: strId
param.text: either the id (_jsxid) of the object or its name (jsxname)

return.text: the JSX object or null if none found

method.text: Looks up a DOM node owned by this server by id or by name.

method.name: getJSXById

param.name: strId
param.text: the id (_jsxid) of the object

return.text: the JSX object or null if none found

method.text: Looks up a DOM node owned by this server by id.

method.name: getJSXByName

param.name: strId
param.text: the name (jsxname) of the object

return.text: the JSX object or null if none found

method.text: Looks up a DOM node owned by this server by name. If more than one such objects exist, only one is returned.

method.name: getLocale
method.text: Returns the current locale of this server. If the locale has been set explicitly with setLocale(), that locale is returned. Otherwise, getDefaultLocale() is consulted, and finally the system-wide locale.

method.name: getProperties
method.text: Returns the dynamic properties registry for this server. The returned object contains the properties contained in all loaded resources of type 'jss' and 'ljss.' It also contains any properties loaded by the system or active add-ins.

method.name: getRenderedOf
method.text: Returns the browser DOM object where a particulat JSX object renders. This method inspects the main root of this server as well as all of its jsx3.gui.Window roots.

method.name: getRootBlock
method.text: Returns the root block for this server (JSXROOT)

method.name: getRootObjects
method.text: Returns the list of objects that are children of the body object. These are the root objects in a serialization file and the root nodes in the Component Hierarchy palette.

method.name: getServer
method.text: Conforms to the EventDispatcher contract.

method.name: getSettings
method.text: Returns the settings of this server/project per config.xml

method.name: getTaskBar

param.name: objJSX
param.text: if null, this.JSXROOT is assumed; otherwise the object in the DOM from which to start looking for a descendant taskbar (a jsx3.gui.WindowBar instance)

method.text: Returns handle to a descendant taskbar belonging to this server instance (this is where JSXDialog instances will try to minimize to if it exists); returns null if none found; if no taskbar is found, dialogs are not minimized, but are 'window shaded'â€”like a Mac used to do

method.name: invokeHelp
method.text: Invokes context-sensitive help as though the user had pressed the help hot key in the context of the DOM node objJSX.

method.name: loadAppWindow

param.name: strSource
param.text: either an XML document containing the window to load or the URL of the component to load.

param.name: objResolver
param.text: If this parameter is provided, strSource is resolved relative to it. Additionally, this resolver is stored as the URI resolver for this DOM node and its descendants.

throws.text: if the loaded entity is not an instance of jsx3.gui.Window or if the name of window is not unique with respect to the already loaded windows

method.text: Loads a new jsx3.gui.Window instance from a component file.

method.name: loadInclude

param.name: strSrc
param.text: the path to the resource.

param.name: strId
param.text: the unique identifier of the resource. A resource loaded by this method may clobber a previously loaded resource of the same type and id.

param.name: strType
param.text: the type of include, one of: css, jss, xml, xsl, script (for JavaScript), services (for mapping rules), or ljss.

param.name: bReload
param.text: if true, a JavaScript or CSS file is reloaded from the remote server without checking the local browser cache. Other types of resources are not affected by this parameter.

return.text: the return type depends on the strType parameter. See the method description.

throws.text: if strType in not a valid type.

method.text:
Loads an external resource into this server instance. What this method does depends on the strType parameter.
script - Loads a JavaScript file asynchronously into the memory space of the page hosting this application; returns null.
css - Loads a CSS file asynchronously into the memory space of the page hosting this application; returns null.
xml or xsl - Loads an XML file synchronously into the XML cache of this application; returns the loaded jsx3.xml.Document instance.
jss or ljss - Loads a dynamic properties file or localized properties bundle synchronously into this application; returns null.
services - Loads and parses a mapping rules file synchronously; returns a new instance of jsx3.net.Service.

method.name: loadResource

param.name: strId
param.text: unique identifier for the resource (its unique id as an application resource file).

return.text: the return type depends on the type of resource. See the documentation for loadInclude() for more information.

method.text: Loads an application resource. This method looks up a resource registered with this application by its id. The resource must be registered in the config.xml file of this application.

method.name: paint

param.name: objXML
param.text: the pre-loaded default component document.

method.text:
Paints this application and its default component into the application view port on the host HTML page. The system class loader calls this method once all the required resources of the application have loaded. The order of actions taken by this method is:
Load the default component file
Execute the onload script for the application
Paint the default component in the view port

param.name: strURI
param.text: the URI to relativize.

method.name: reloadLocalizedResources
method.text: Reloads all resource files that are localized. This method should be called after calling setLocale() for the server to render properly in the new locale.

method.name: resolveURI

param.name: strURI
param.text: the URI to resolve.

method.text: Resolves a URI that is referenced from a file in this server. This method takes into account the changes in resource addressing between 3.1 and 3.2. For version 3.1, the URI is resolved as any URI in the system, using jsx3.resolveURI(). In version 3.2, the URI is taken as relative to the application folder. In particular, a relative URI will be resolved to a base of the application folder, an absolute URI will be unaffected.

method.name: setCookie

param.name: name
param.text: name of the cookie

param.name: value
param.text: value of the cookie

param.name: expires
param.text: valid jscript date object. for example: new Date("11:59:59 12-31-2004")

param.name: path
param.text: path where the cookie is valid (default: path of calling document)

param.name: domain
param.text: domain where the cookie is valid (default: domain of calling document)

param.name: secure
param.text: valid jscript date object. for example: new Date("11:59:59 12-31-2004")

method.text: Sets a Cookie with the given name and value

method.name: setDimensions

param.name: left
param.text: the new left value or a JavaScript array containing all four new values (in pixels)

param.name: top
param.text: the new top value (in pixels)

param.name: width
param.text: the new width value (in pixels)

param.name: height
param.text: the new height value (in pixels)

method.text: set all four dimensions for a jsx3.Server instance, allowing the developer to adjust the width/height/left/width for the server. Must be called during/after the onload event for the server instance as it affects the VIEW for the server. Updates the absolutely positioned element that contains JSXROOT.

method.name: setDynamicProperty

param.name: strPropName
param.text: id for this dynamic property among all properties

param.name: vntValue
param.text: value of the property; if null, the property with the name, @strPropName will be removed

method.text: updates a single dynamic style property; dynamic properties are used by jsx3.gui.Block objects that extend the astract class, jsx3.gui.Block;

method.name: setLocale
method.text: Sets the locale of this server.

method.name: unloadInclude

param.name: strId
param.text: the id used when loading the resource.

method.text: Removes a loaded JavaScript or CSS resource from the browser DOM.

method.name: getVersion

return.text: app version number (major (MM), minor (mm), and dot release (dd)) MM.mm.dd

method.text: Returns version of the JSX runtime; separate versions are also available for GUI and Operational classes
